etymologies: mid 18th century: from French, from Hungarian vampir, perhaps from Turkish uber ‘witch’

definitions: a corpse supposed, in European folklore, to leave its grave at night to drink the blood of the living by biting their necks with long pointed canine teeth.
shortDefinitions: corpse supposed to leave its grave at night

definitions: a person who preys ruthlessly on others

examples.text: the protectionist vampires in the Congress

shortDefinitions: person who preys ruthlessly on others

definitions: a small bat that feeds on the blood of mammals or birds using its two sharp incisor teeth and anticoagulant saliva, found mainly in tropical America.

notes.text: Family Desmodontidae (or Phyllostomidae): three species, in particular the common vampire (Desmodus rotundus)

shortDefinitions: small bat that feeds on blood of mammals or birds using its two sharp incisor teeth
